alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Ventura County Inland Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 14 at 10:26AM PST until February 16 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For both Freeze Watches, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 30 degrees possible. * WHERE...Ventura County Inland Coast and Southeastern Ventura County Valleys. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the first Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Wednesday morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from late Wednesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Ventura County Inland Coast
